title: Animals are damaging the over 50s cars
text: Animals are becoming an increasing risk to drivers over 50s according to analysis of Saga Car Insurance claims data. In 2014, Saga reportedly handled 500 car insurance claims involving animals, totalling up to almost £1million in a damage to vehicles driven by the over 50s. During a hike round Dartmoor National Park one customer returned to find 12 horses licking the paintwork off his car, causing £1200 worth of damage. One cat caused almost £4000 worth of damage to a car after hiding in the bonnet, while another policyholder was left shocked after he was ambushed by some deer. On his way back from a wedding, a stag "appeared out of nowhere", causing him to slam on the brakes. Unfortunately, another stag appeared moments later and ploughed straight into his car, causing £2000 worth of damage. Check for stage fright before you take your cow somewhere Photo: Alamy Another customer attempted to take his cow to a cattle show to see if she could win a prize. After he tied her to a post, the cow got strage fridge and made a run for it, uprooting the post and dragging it around the car park, causing £800 worth of damage to the parked car. One driver crashed his car into a bridge in an attempt to avoid hitting a mallard. Luckily, the duck escaped with just a few ruffled feather, while the driver caused £1500 worth of damage to the bridge. Saga's chief executive Roger Ramsden said: “It seems that just about anything can send a road trip into turmoil and the over 50s have to have their wits about them when they’re in the driver’s seat. “We understand that some things are out of our customers control and that they can’t predict when they may face low flying ducks or deers darting across the road." telegraph.co.uk
